meanings.definition: A person who has the charge or direction of some office or department; a superintendent or manager.
meanings.sent1: The intendant of the school made sure everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The intendant oversaw the construction project from start to finish.
meanings.sent3: The intendant jokingly declared himself the 'chief organizer of chaos'.
meanings.sent4: She was the intendant of happiness, spreading joy wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: As the intendant of the garden, he meticulously planned each plant's placement.

meanings.definition: A title given to a high administrative officer in France and some other countries.
meanings.sent1: The intendant in the royal court was responsible for managing finances.
meanings.sent2: The intendant's role was crucial in maintaining order in the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The intendant playfully referred to himself as the 'chief of paperwork'.
meanings.sent4: She ruled the company with the precision of an intendant overseeing a kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The intendant's authority was as clear as the sun in the sky.
